#  Top 17 Blockchain as a Service Providers

______________

in Blockchain

As the adoption of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology rapidly grows,
businesses from finance, healthcare, music, and other significant industries
adopt Blockchain as a Service (BaaS) to easily leverage the speed,
transparency, and security offered by blockchain technology.

Including major cloud service providers AWS, IBM and, Azure, the list contains
17 top Blockchain as a Service providers that help businesses implement
blockchain technology.

* * *

  * What is Blockchain-as-a-Service (BaaS)?

  * Oracle Blockchain Cloud Service
  * Kaleido
  * Corda

Blockchain, the most popular type of decentralized/distributed ledger
technology (DLT), is a digital database technology that records transactions
in a distributed ledger of computer networks to enhance secure, decentralized,
and transparent transmission of data.

Since the invention of Bitcoin - a currency built on the blockchain DLT in
2008, blockchain technology has gained massive adoption and leverage by
different companies and individuals to make more scalable, secure, and
transparent business solutions.

Considering the cost and non-feasibility for companies to build their
blockchain from scratch, there is a need for pre-built platforms that allow
implementing blockchain products by building business solutions on existing
infrastructure, hence adopting blockchain as a service (BaaS).

##  **What is Blockchain-as-a-Service (BaaS)?**

Blockchain as a Service (BaaS), like Software as a Service (SaaS), is a
blockchain platform installed, hosted, and managed by third-party cloud
service providers. BaaS allows businesses to build and host their blockchain
applications and smart contracts while using the service provider’s cloud
infrastructure.

Adopting Blockchain as a Service saves time and enables businesses to easily
leverage blockchain to provide more convenient, reliable, and sophisticated
solutions.

Major cloud service providers also provide a managed BaaS service, making it
easier for businesses to integrate blockchain in existing cloud services.

Let's look at some of the most popular Blockchain as a Service providers that
aid the easy adoption and implementation of blockchain into existing business
technology.

##  **IBM Blockchain Platform**

IBM Blockchain Platform is a Blockchain-as-a-Service platform offered as part
of the robust IBM cloud services. It deploys Hyperledger Fabric - one of the
two most popular open-source blockchain frameworks - which provides
enterprises with the necessary tools to build, host, deploy, and maintain
blockchain-based business solutions.

##  **Oracle Blockchain Cloud Service**

Oracle Blockchain Cloud offers a Blockchain-as-a-Service platform built on the
Hyperledger Fabric blockchain framework. Oracle’s enterprise BaaS platform
provides permissioned blockchain networks that help businesses increase
transparency, trust and, transaction agility across their networks.

##  **Kaleido**

Kaleido is a multi-cloud blockchain platform that helps clients manage
blockchain networks across Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure.

Kaleido’s production-ready enterprise Blockchain-as-a-Service platform helps
businesses quickly build and manage cloud-based blockchain applications.

##  **Corda**

Corda is a finance-focused open-source BaaS platform provided by R3, a New
York-based blockchain solutions provider. Corda enables companies to enhance
financial settlements by making the transactions direct, secure, and private
using smart contracts and blockchain technology.

##  **Azure Blockchain Services**

As part of Azure cloud services, Microsoft offers a BaaS platform that
integrates with other Microsoft services such as Logic Apps and Flow. Azure
Blockchain Services allows enterprises to leverage its extensive cloud
infrastructure to build, manage and deploy cutting-edge blockchain
applications and networks at a large scale.

##  **Dragonchain**

Dragonchain is a hybrid enterprise BaaS platform that prioritizes data
security. It enables enterprises to quickly build scalable blockchain
applications that easily integrate with its LMS (Learning Management System),
Decentralized Identity, and Anti-Fraud systems to enhance the ease of use,
security, and transparency.

##  **Amazon Managed Blockchain**

As a part of its sophisticated cloud service, Amazon offers a full-featured
managed blockchain service built on Hyperledger Fabric and Ethereum
frameworks.

Amazon managed blockchain is an easy-to-use platform that provides AWS
Blockchain Templates and other resources that help enterprises to quickly
build and deploy highly efficient and scalable blockchain solutions at scale.

##  **Bloq**

Bloq offers various blockchain tools that help businesses build intelligent
contracts and blockchain solutions that solve critical business issues like
authentication and security. It allows companies to store and manage
blockchain applications built on the platform. Individuals or businesses can
also personalize bloq’s BaaS platform based on the users’ needs.

##  **HPE Mission-Critical DLT**

HPE mission-critical decentralized ledger technology is a BaaS platform that
helps enterprises leverage its blockchain tools, and cloud compute power to
build blockchain-based business solutions. It integrates explicitly with other
BaaS platforms such as Corda to make fast and highly scalable blockchain
applications.

##  **MultiBaaS**

Built on Ethereum blockchain, MultiBaaS is a Blockchain-as-a-service product
offered by Curvegrid. The platform enables users to build and deploy
decentralized applications faster and easier on its blockchain infrastructure.

##  **Alibaba Cloud Blockchain as a Service**

Alibaba Cloud Blockchain as a Service is an enterprise BaaS platform built on
the Hyperledger Fabric, Quorum, and Ant Blockchain technologies. It integrates
with Alibaba Cloud Internet of Things and anti-counterfeiting technologies to
build quickly, deploy and manage fast, secure, and highly reliable cloud-based
blockchain solutions.

##  **akaChain**

akaChain is an enterprise Hyperledger Fabric-based platform that addresses
security, transparency, and trust using blockchain technology. It integrates
with Software Development Kits (SDKs) to build business-enhancing blockchain
solutions.

##  **Aergo**

Aergo is a hybrid BaaS platform that enables businesses to quickly design,
build, and deploy cloud-based blockchain solutions. Aergo is built on Blocko’s
Coinstack, a full-featured enterprise-scale Bitcoin blockchain solution.

##  **VMware Blockchain**

VMware Blockchain is an enterprise blockchain platform that enables users to
build, run and deploy scalable decentralized applications. It integrates with
smart contracts and execution interfaces such as DAML Ledger and EVM to build
secure and efficient blockchain environments.

##  **Symbiont**

Symbiont BaaS platform focuses on building financial transparency and security
with its blockchain platform. It provides blockchain services for banks and
other fintech companies to build secure, transparent, and scalable cloud-based
applications on its platform.

##  **Blockstream**

Blockstream creates a secure financial infrastructure for building Bitcoin-
based peer-to-peer financial solutions. It provides various products that
integrate with its Bitcoin blockchain technology to develop fast and efficient
financial services.

##  **Aurachain**

Aurachain’s BaaS platform is a low-code blockchain solution that allows you to
build scalable and efficient enterprise applications. It helps to develop
blockchain solutions with its intuitive and easy-to-use tools rapidly.
